text: Meargh Skattach
The maddened matriarch of the Rancor Hold Fimir, Skattach is a powerful sorceress. Having declared herself Hell-Mother - ruler of all Fimir - she now seeks to bring about the revival of her race.

A Daemon Princess of the Fimir, worshipped as a demi-goddess by her kin, Kroll is a cunning and dreadful creature - All-Mother to the Bog Octopuses and, to the Fimir, rightful ruler of all the worldâ€™s marshes.
Kroll
Fog-Shrine of Balor
Bog Octopus

Fog-Shrines are roving altars dedicated to the Fimir demi-god Balor of the Dead-Dealing Eye. They are the ruined remains of enemy temples, now inhabited by evil entities known as Tentacled Eyes, capable of unleashing blasts of pure malevolent energy from their giant eye.

Bog Octopuses are giant and terrible cephalopods that inhabit the marshes and swamps of the Old World. They are both admired and feared by the Fimir, who placate these creatures with sacrifices - often hapless Boglars, and occasionally even stray humans. Sometimes, the Fimir succeed in coaxing one of these beasts into battle, where they are a truly terrifying sight to behold.
Daemonomaniac

One of the most successful experiments of the Dirach caste, Daemonomaniac candidates are chosen from among the Fimm caste. Dirach Balefiends perform a complex and horrifying ritual in which they bind the soul of a Daemon into the body of a Fimm warrior, causing him to painfully mutate - growing to enormous size and acquiring great strength, speed, and other daemonic abilities. The result is a terrifying sight to behold on the battlefield.

The cruel and degenerate Fimir are a race of one-eyed amphibian marsh-dwellers who used to be the favourites of the Ruinous Powers, before Humanity appeared on the world. Having fallen from grace ever since, they now inhabit ruined strongholds in the marshes and bogs of the world, brooding and waiting for a chance to enact their revenge on Mankind and retaking their rightful place in the eyes of the Chaos Gods.

"We are older than humankind, but closer to the gods. We are less numerous than humankind, but understand our place in the world more clearly. We may never be greater than humankind, but we will endure at least as long. You know virtually nothing about us, but we know all we need to know about you"\\n\\n- Unnamed Fimir Matriarch

Them Fimir are just monsters, same as the Orcs, same as the Beastmen, same as the mutant scum. Ugly bastard monsters, that's all. King Marius and the Jutones sorted them once, and if they ever cause trouble again, then, by the Gods, we'll damn well sort them ourselves! Don't credit them with any special powers, that's all just peasant superstition. Come on, think about it, if they really did have any power worth having, would they really live out in sodden, stinking mudholes?\\n\\n- Ruud Hiservook, Wastelander Trapper

The Shearl represent the lowest caste in the Fimir hierarchy, but are most numerous of the Fimir. They are thralls, doing most of the labouring needed to keep Fimir society running. This ranges from collecting food to mining any available metals to fashioning armours and weapons for the Fimm warriors. The Shearl also do most of the building and maintenance work around the strongholds. In other words, the Shearl are the craftsmen and labourers of the Fimir.

The Fimm are the true warriors of the Fimir race. Their duty is to fight to ensure the safety of their Meargh, their stronghold and their clan. They rank more highly than the Shearl, but are beneath the Dirach and the Meargh. The Fimm are not quite as numerous as the Shearl, but they still form a large percentage of a typical clan. It is actually a relatively complex caste, with divisions within it based on physical appearance and size.

The Dirach, often called Daemon-Friends or Balefiends for the close relationships they form with individual Daemons, are wizards controlling powerful instinctive magic. They act as a buffer between the Meargh and her clan, relaying messages between the two, allowing her to pursue her own magical activities and concerns. Dirach are very few in number compared to the lower Shearl and Fimm castes, but command great respect and power.

The Meargh, also called  witch-queens, sometimes matriarchs, are the undisputed leaders of the Fimir clans, and the only females in Fimir society. Few of them are born and they are immediately taken by another Meargh as an apprentice. Wielders of great magic, commanding both Daemons and the elements and able to scry what the future holds, The Meargh are terrifying beings capable of great cruelty (and occasionally generosity) when the need arises.
Fimir
Nuckelavees

These horrifying, flayed amalgams of man and horse are among the cruellest and most monstrous of the daemons summoned by the Fimir. Once they emerge from their refuges beneath the waters, only destruction satisfies their merciless crusade.
